item.title: About
item.description:
I’m a technology guy with an education in UX, computer science and technology commercialisation. I’ve spent several years working bringing research to commercialisation and managing consultancy projects with companies in Ireland and the USA.

I love science, technology, craft beer, whisky and statistics.
item.dc:creator: Eoin Brazil

item.title: Introduction to Machine Learning with R
item.description:
I had the pleasure of presenting to the Dublin R User Group on machine learning. My talk source and examples are in a Github repo. The talk was aimed at introducing machine learning to the group as I hope to follow this talk up with more intermediate topics.

Overview

The techniques covered included:

  • Data transformation
  • Model building
  • Model assessment and selection
  • Interpreting a confusion matrix
  • Interpreting a ROC plot
  • Approaches to handling prediction errors
  • Addressing feature selection
  • Kaggle and data science competitions
  • A review of various ML techniques:
    • Associate rules
    • Decision trees
    • Random forests
    • k Nearest Neighbors
    • Neural networks
    • Support vector machines
    • Naive bayesian
  • OpenRefine and Rattle
  • Useful command line tools for a data scientist

Background

The classification of objects into groups is a everyday task for humans and this talk helps highlight how to develop models to allow machines to do these tasks. The talk provide a quick understanding of machine learning algorithms showing how they worked, so that people would know when and how to best apply them. Machine learning and particularly feature generation for those models is seen as a “black art” due to the fact that domain expertise is required. The talk was aimed at showing people how R can be used in the process of selecting, assessing and creating models. It gave four datasets to show examples of exploratory data analysis.

Talk slides
item.dc:creator: Eoin Brazil

item.title: Omnigraffle, Climacons and Font Awesome
item.description:
I recently been doing a few sketches using Omnigraffle and realised that I had to create my first stencils to easy the graphical prototyping I’d been working on. The first font is the excellent Font Awesome and it already had a great stencil from Pat Cheung that I merely needed to update from his version to include the latest release of the font. The second font was a really nice climate icon font, Climacons that did not have any stencil.

I really took some inspiration from Pat’s work and have sent a pull request back to his Github so hopefully the stencil will be updated. I really think that Dave Gandy and all the Font Awesome contributors have really created something so useful for wire framing.

Font Awesome Stencil

Firstly, down load the system font file from the project’s website and then install this font on your computer. You can then download the stencil from my (Github project)[], double click the stencil file to install it. The links for these are:

  • Font Awesome: http://fontawesome.io
  • Font Awesome 4.0.1 OmniGraffle Stencil github: https://github.com/braz/Font-Awesome-OmniGraffle-Stencil

Climacons Stencil

Firstly, down load the system font file from the project’s website or the Github repository and then install this font on your computer. You can then download the stencil from my (Github project)[], double click the stencil file to install it. The links for these are:

  • Climacons font: http://adamwhitcroft.com/climacons/font/
  • Climacons github: https://github.com/AdamWhitcroft/Climacons
  • Climacons Omnigraffle Stencil github: https://github.com/braz/climacons-omnigraffle-stencil

Hope you find these of use and feel free to submit pull requests as I intend to try and keep these updated.
item.dc:creator: Eoin Brazil
